title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News
summary: councils urged to deal with 'nuisance ' knotweed .
volunteers celebrate award for helping vulnerable mums .
saints take on exeter at franklins gardens .
microbreweries in the county 'fantastic ' , says conservative mp .

documents.title: today 's weather : mainly dry this morning
text: it 's a chilly start to the new working week and this morning will be mainly dry with sunny spells .
it 's due to turn cloudy later and there could be some heavy rain , hail and thunder in the beds , herts and bucks area .
maximum temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: virgin trains east coast rail staff on strike
text: workers on virgin trains east coast have begun a 24-hour strike this morning in a long-running dispute over jobs .
the rmt union said about 1,800 members , including train crew and some drivers , are taking action against threatened job cuts and disputes over working conditions and safety .
virgin trains east coast , which operates services between london , eastern england and scotland , said it was making changes to customer-facing roles .

the company said it would be running a full timetable during the strike but there will be some changes to on-board catering and it may not be able to open the food bar or run a trolley service in standard class , and the first class menu will be reduced .
i think the message is to stock up on food before you travel .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: welcome back to live updates for northamptonshire
text: good morning .
it 's the start of another week and there is plenty going on , including a 24-hour strike on virgin trains east coast .
we 'll soon bring you a round-up of the weekend 's sport and today 's weather forecast too .
bit foggy this morning is n't it best take care on your travels .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the devils of broughton
text: the devils of broughton

text: northampton town 2-3 bristol rovers

text: bringing down an unwanted drone

text: statue sale council 'warned by lawyers '

text: northampton 20-19 exeter
author: Brendon Mitchell
BBC Sport

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: that 's the end of our rolling updates for today , but any breaking news will still appear here .
stories we 've covered today include :
do n't forget to join us again from 08:00 on monday when we 'll have all the latest news , sport , weather and traffic updates for northamptonshire .
here 's a lovely of long buckby sent in to bbc weather watchers by keen camper .
have a great weekend .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: anti-drone 'spider-man web ' developed
text: and finally a northampton graduate has launched one of the first anti-drone security companies , offering products such as a firing net , similar to spider-man 's web , to capture nuisance flying machines .
sales of the unmanned flying devices have dramatically increased over the past two years , but it has led to a three-fold increase in drone-related incidents being reported to police .
richard gill said : `` after seeing reports of drones being used irresponsibly near airports and flying drugs into prisons i thought that i should do something about it . ''
here it is in action .
you can see more tonight on bbc look east at 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Mike Cartwright
BBC Look East

documents.title: weather : dry tonight but turning wet tomorrow
text: isolated showers this evening will fade away to leave much of the night dry with clear spells , and perhaps a few mist patches .
turning chilly with light winds , as temperatures fall to 6c ( 43f ) in prone rural spots .
sunny spells on saturday , particularly at first , but an increasing risk of showers or longer spells of rain developing , some heavy with hail and thunder , and perhaps some local flooding .
feeling notably cool with light and variable winds , and temperatures only reaching 16c ( 61f ) .
get your full local weekend forecast from bbc weather .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: bats monitored as part of wildlife survey
text: the wildlife trust has been busy with its bat monitoring programme today .
forty bats were found in stoke wood end quarter , an undisturbed woodland two miles from desborough .
as the footage shows , the bats are placed in the bag temporarily before being checked by qualified bat surveyors , and then released as part of the annual bat survey .
forty brown-eared bats in a bag !
all part of our monitoring work at stoke wood end quarter .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: homeless man attacked while he slept
text: a homeless man was repeatedly kicked while he slept in a recreation ground in towcester .
the attack off islington road happened sometime between 22:00 and midnight on wednesday .
he was kicked in the upper body , causing bruising to his torso .
it 's believed the offenders ran away along islington road .
anyone with information can contact northamptonshire police on 101 .

documents.title: 'there 's a lot of work to do ' , says environment secretary
text: south northamptonshire mp andrea leadsom says she is still looking at whether farming subsidy can be maintained at its current level after 2020 .
the secretary of state for the environment has been speaking to bbc radio northampton on a visit to wellingborough today .
she leads the department that is looking at what farming subsidy should look like after leaving the eu .
mrs leadsom says she wants to think about ''how can we really support the brilliant work that our farmers and fisherman do ? ''
she always wants `` our generation to leave the environment in a better state than we found it , but at the same time focus on the uk rather than 28 eu members of state .
there 's a lot of work to do to get to that '' .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: microbreweries in the county 'fantastic ' , says conservative mp
text: secretary of state for environment , food and rural affairs , andrea leadsom , has praised the work of microbreweries in the county .
the number of small independent breweries in northamptonshire has more than doubled in the past six years .
on a visit to hart family brewers in wellingborough , the south northamptonshire mp said it was `` fantastic '' news that new businesses were on the increase .
''it 's a real growing activity they 're popping up all over the place .
it 's so important .
we 're seeing so many new businesses starting up right across the board . ''
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: saints ' hooker shows drawing talent
text: saints ' hooker mikey haywood is part of the line-up facing exeter this evening , but did you know he could draw too ?
mikey came into bbc radio northampton to draw a of next week 's special guest on the radio station 's sports programme .
can you guess who it is ?
see the full video and post your comments on bbc northampton 's facebook page .

documents.title: strictly : lesley prepares to cha-cha with anton
text: she 's currently hard at work practising in the training room , but how will she do this week on the dancefloor ?
northampton-born lesley joseph and dance partner anton will be dancing the cha-cha to the pussycat dolls ' version of `` perhaps perhaps perhaps '' tomorrow on strictly come dancing .
see how all the couples fare this saturday at 18:20 on bbc one .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: alan carr thanks fans after wedding proposal
text: northampton 's `` chatty man '' alan carr has thanked fans for their messages of congratulations , after he revealed he has got engaged to long-term partner paul drayton .
the couple were enjoying a holiday in indonesia last week when actor paul popped the question during a meal .
alan said paul hid the engagement ring in his dessert - what a delicious surprise !
alan carr
alancarr
thank you so so much for all the lovely messages ! ! ! !
who 'd have thought it ? ! ! ! ! !
thank you so so much for all the lovely messages ! ! ! !
who 'd have thought it ? ! ! ! !
congratulations !

awww lovely news for you both @ twitterid congratulations x

or should i say , `` well what a week it 's been '' .

author: Helen Popham

documents.title: body talk is coming your way # bbcbodytalk
text: in honour of women 's sport week ( 3-10 october ) , bbc get inspired and radio 1xtra have teamed up for an intimate and interactive discussion on body image issues for women in and around sport .
full details about how you can be there , get involved and watch it live can be found here .

documents.title: in the papers today
text: the northampton chronicle and echo report that one in three people are still unaware about the roles of the police and crime commissioner four years after the role was created .
northampton-born comedian alan carr has announced he is engaged to marry his long-term actor boyfriend after discovering the engagement ring in his dessert , northampton 's herald and post reports .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'the real life forrest gump ' # getinspired
text: in the last year , ben smith has run over 10,000 miles across britain in all weather .
he is nearing the end of his challenge to run 401 marathons on consecutive days .
find out more about ben 's task with this video .

documents.title: robbery images release by police
text: police are appealing for help in finding two men who robbed a costcutter store in irthlingborough yesterday .
two cctv images have been released by northamptonshire police after the pair entered the shop in the high street sometime around 21:00 .
one of the men remained at the front entrance , while the second offender approached the tills and jumped over the counter .
he then used a hammer to smash open two tills and removed hundreds of pounds of cash .
both offenders then ran towards finedon road .
police are also urging two teenagers who were in the store at the time and passed by the offender at the door to come forward .

documents.title: sport : saints tonight and a big weekend of football
text: northampton saints will be chasing their first home win of the season in the premiership tonight when they entertain exeter chiefs at franklin 's gardens .
the team has n't had a great start to the season with just one victory from four starts so far , leaving them 10th in the table .
there 's full coverage on bbc radio northampton from 19:00 .
in football , northampton town are on home turf at sixfields tomorrow entertaining bristol rovers .
they 're looking to maintain their strong start to the season in league one , with the side currently 4th in the table .
meanwhile , it 's also a big weekend in the fa cup for three of our non-league sides .
brackley town travel to fellow national league north outfit worcester city and kettering town also have national league north opposition as they entertain boston at latimer park .
afc rushden and diamonds travel to hendon from the isthmian league , whilse corby town travel to warrington in the northern premier league .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: this afternoon 's weather
text: this afternoon will be a mix of sunshine and scattered showers , some could be heavy with a risk of thunder at times .
it will feel a little cooler than of late .
maximum temperature will be 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: council considers council tax support cut
text: daventry is becoming the latest area of the county to consider cutting council tax support for people on low incomes .
claimants could be asked to pay a higher proportion of their bills .
officials say there are several options available , including increasing the minimum amount people pay towards their bills from a fifth to a third .
claimants could lose the benefit if they go abroad for more than a month , or the number of children taken into account when calculating the reduction could be cut to two .
pensioners wo n't be affected by any changes and a consultation 's under way until 10 november .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: art teacher pays tribute to armed forces
text: an art teacher from northampton has drawn 456 portraits of soldiers killed in action in afghanistan as a tribute to members of the armed forces .
sam bailey , who teaches at the caroline chisholm school , will use her work to raise funds for the royal british legion .
she told bbc radio northampton : ''you have a dream , you decide this is what you want to do and you go for it , and i must admit halfway through i thought , 'what on earth am i doing ? '
`` but i had thousands of messages of support from the families and it 's that which kept me going . ''
author: Stuart Linnell
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton knotweed outbreak criticised
text: a northampton borough councillor says more needs to be done about the growing problem of japanese knotweed , which can grow up to 20cm ( 8in ) a day during the summer .
lib dem councillor brian markham says during his recent election campaign he was alerted to a problem with the weed on a footpath next to the westone estate in the town .
`` what worries me is this is on council land and actually about to invade people 's gardens .
the council would be liable for letting the problem spread to residents ' gardens , '' he said .
meanwhile , japanese knotweed expert , brian taylor , has also recently visited an outbreak on the weedon road near to sixfields
he said : `` this single plant will continue to spread naturally every fragment of the plant that is broken off will then be spread and grown into new plants '' .
it is the landowner 's responsibility to get rid of the plant .
in 2014 legislation allowed councils to take action to force people to do so , but this has not happened in northamptonshire .
a spokesperson for northampton borough council said it is `` not responsible for handling reports of japanese knotweed '' .
`` natural england holds information for the public regarding its legal status and the environment agency offers guidance and advice of proper control and disposal methods of japanese knotweed . ''
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: volunteers celebrate award for helping vulnerable mums
text: an organisation which distributes essentials for vulnerable new mums and their babies has won a special award from the northamptonshire community foundation .
baby basics , which is a volunteer-led project , won the newcomers award .
sebrina oakey from the group says it 's been very busy in the last few years .
'we 're nearly up to the 500 mark - 500 baskets distributed throughout northamptonshire , '' she said .
''we send out clothing and toiletries for the mum and for the baby , as well as a box of chocolates which is important for the mum ! ''
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: today 's weather : sunny spells , but you might need a brolly
text: cambridgeshire along with beds , herts and bucks will be mainly dry with sunny spells today , but with some heavy showers possible this afternoon .
it will also be feeling cooler , with a maximum temperature of 17c ( 62f ) .
in northamptonshire , however , there 'll be sunny spells and scattered showers throughout today , and some of those showers may be heavy with a risk of thunder at times .
it 'll be breezy during the morning too and feel a little cooler than of late , with a top temperature of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: happy friday ! welcome to our live updates
text: good morning and welcome back to our regular updates from the local live team in northamptonshire .
as always , we 'll be with you until 18:00 this evening bringing you all today 's news , weather , sport and travel .
you can get in touch with all your comments , photographs and news via email , facebook or twitter .
a full weather forecast is coming up next .
meanwhile , here 's the view in pattishall this morning thanks to weather watcher paula-maria .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's the end of our rolling updates for today , but any breaking news will still appear here overnight .
stories we 've covered today include :
do n't forget to join us again from 08:00 tomorrow when we 'll have all the latest news , sport , weather and traffic updates for northamptonshire .
have a great evening .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : clear spells with chilly temperatures
text: a fine end to the day and staying dry overnight with lengthy clear spells .
turning chilly with temperatures dropping to single figures .
lows of 7-9c ( 45-48f ) tonight .
there will be a dry and bright start to friday with some pleasant spells of autumn sunshine .
some isolated showers developing later , mainly affecting western counties .
highs of 18c ( 64f ) .
for more details see bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: no deal in the pipeline for corby steel
text: workers at the tata steel plant in corby are still in the dark after it was revealed that a deal to sell three other uk tata factories could be signed within the next few weeks .
yesterday the bbc learned that liberty house has placed a firm offer to buy the steelworks in rotherham , stocksbridge and hartlepool but there was no mention of corby .
the leader of corby borough council , tom beattie , says they remain very hopeful for the future ,

''it does n't dishearten me completely because i think the corby centre is clearly in a better position than some of the other sites across the country with a good order book , the financial outlook looks better than it has for some time . ''
''so i 'm confident that hopefully a buyer can found for corby , unfortunately not this time round . ''

documents.title: ducket 'phenomenal ' says loyenorthampton
text: new england call-up ben duckett has become the first player to win the professional cricketers ' association young player of the year and players ' player of the year awards in the same season .
the 21-year-old northamptonshire batsman who flies to bangladesh with his england team-mates today .
former england and northamptonshire batsman mal loye says duckett is `` phenomenal '' .
he says ''to score so heavily , it 's really a credit to him , not just technically but tactically , it 's fully deserved , both awards and the writers award '' .
special way to finish the season !
thank you for all the support
@ twitterid @ twitterid well done @ twitterid
now go and score a zillion runs for england and northants .
now to emulate this summer 's success over in bangladesh and india .
fully deserved awards !
congratulations ben , fully deserved .
now for @ twitterid good to see you and good luck in the winter , @ twitterid
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: a45 roadworks information : weedon , flore , dodford and daventry
text: if your drive to work involves the a45 between daventry and northampton , you might be interested in @ a45daventrylink .
you may remember bbc radio northampton reporting on some rather alarming signs warning about roadworks which would last 90 weeks .
it 's the construction of the long awaited flore bypass , officially known as the daventry link road , between weedon and junction 16 of the m1 .
the new road is due to be completed by early 2018 .
welcome to balfour beatty 's a45 daventry link rd project twitter feed where we aim to keep you abreast of news , info & updates @ twitterid

documents.title: police appeal for missing teenager
text: police are appealing for information about the whereabouts of missing ismail sherzad , last seen at his home address in troon crescent in wellingborough on saturday 27 august .
ismail , 16 , is of middle eastern appearance .
he is 5ft 5in , of slim build and has dark hair and brown eyes .
he was last seen wearing dark clothing .
police believe he may now be in the kent area .

documents.title: sports news : saints v exeter
text: callum clark is set to make his return for northampton saints when exeter visit franklin 's gardens tomorrow night .
clark has n't played since august 2015 with a serious shoulder injury .
but he has been named in the team for friday 's night 's game .
the only change to the saints side who lost to wasps last week .
read the full preview on bbc sport .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: whitlock wants your unsung heroes # bbcunsunghero
text: make sure you get your nominations in for your local unsung hero before the deadline of 23 october !
find out how to here .

documents.title: weather watchers : what 's that cloud ?
text: it 's certainly been a mixed day weather-wise in the county today - both sun and rain and plenty of clouds !
but how well do you know your stratocumulus from your cumulonimbus ?
if you need a quick refresher , bbc weather watchers have an article on cloud formations online as well as lots of other piece of weather related information .
thanks to willow for a. of the raunds countryside and blues shoes for a tree filled corby sky .
send in your by joining bbc weather watchers here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: woman punched and sexually assaulted in northampton
text: police say a woman has been punched and sexually assaulted on st andrews street in northampton .
she was walking home between 01:00 and 03:00 on saturday morning when the attack happened as she was passing the salvation army centre .
the suspect is described as white , around 5ft 10ins tall , of medium build , in his early 30s and with pale skin .
he had short blond hair and was wearing a white polo top and grey shorts .
anyone with information is being asked to contact northamptonshire police on 101 .

documents.title: weather : mainly dry this afternoon
text: it will be a mainly dry afternoon after a rather grey and wet start to the day .
there 'll be plenty of sunny spells but it will be fairly breezy and feeling a bit cooler than yesterday .
the maximum temperature being 18c ( 64f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: subsidy grants over £ 160,000 for largest farmers
text: five northamptonshire farmers receive more than £ 160,000 a year in eu subsidy , with the largest sum going to the family of earl spencer .
the campaign group greenpeace says the `` brexit '' vote provides a chance for the whole subsidy system to be reformed .
national figures show wealthy recipients of farm grants include the billionaire saudi prince khalid abdullah al-saud as well as the queen and the duke of westminster .
but simon fisher , from the national farmers union in this region , says those figures are not ty
''the average level in this country is £ 16,000 .
the examples in the top 100 are high because they have large amounts of land .
putting it in perspective , there are n't thousands of farmers out there getting huge amounts of money from the european common agricultural policy . ''

documents.title: local paper round upnorthampton
text: the daventry express reports on how two brothers from a daventry chippy saved the life of their colleague by performing cpr .
the northamptonshire telegraph says speeding and dangerous driving have been identified as the top three policing priorities for every district and borough in northamptonshire .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pollution hotspot needs sorting , say green party
text: air pollution is higher at northampton bus station than in any other part of the town , according to research by the green party .
the group says its measurements show the area should be made an `` air quality management '' zone to deal with the pollution .
it said the location of the northgate bus station , which opened in march 2014 , has made the situation worse .
tony clarke , of the green party , says the council 's analysis of the sites before development began did not consider air quality .
''they looked at whether or not it was good for the economy , whether it was socially acceptable but they never looked at air quality , '' he said .

northampton borough council says it does n't intend to declare a new `` air quality management area '' because they want a more `` holistic '' approach across the whole borough , not just in specific locations .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: first ever managing director for kettering boroughnorthampton
text: a restructuring of kettering borough council has been approved with the appointment of its first ever managing director .
graham soulsby , currently a deputy chief executive at the council , will take on the role which replaces the current post of chief executive .
concerns were voiced at last night 's council meeting about mr soulsby 's salary , which will be just under £ 130,000 .

documents.title: 'we want our ground back ' say poppies fans
text: about 4,500 fans have signed a petition to make rockingham road football stadium an asset of community value and for the ground to be listed in the register of community assets by kettering borough council .

the fans are urging the borough council to help them return to their old home ground but last night , at the council 's full meeting , the authority 's chief executive david cook told them that hope was ''unlikely '' as the disused ground has n't been in community use ''in recent years '' .
hundreds of poppies fans demonstrated outside kettering borough council offices chanting `` we want our ground back '' .
martin jeffs started the petition and he says they 'll continue to make their case to the council .
he said : .
'the support that we got from our own fans was phenomenal , 4,500 signatures and then over 400 people turning up last night .
the people in the council were saying the right words i 'm hopeful that it will take us in the right direction moving forward . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: mornin ' m'duck where 's your accent gowin ?
text: as we mentioned earlier , it 's claimed the northamptonshire accent is under threat .
a report out today says people 's mobility is eroding the traditional way of speaking in many areas .

colin eaton , who has written a book about the northamptonshire dialect , said : ''we 've got lots of firms moving into the area and are attracting lots of people from various parts it will gradually dilute itself right out but there will be pockets here and there where the accent will stay for some time yet . ''
so which words or phrases have you heard ( or misheard ) in the county ?
here are a few i 've heard recently and their translations :
'pap ' - .
grandpa
'air 'elen ' - as in 'our helen '
'gowin dan dunget ' - going down derngate
'gal ' - young girl or lady
'see yer layer ' - see you later
'wat air yer dowin ? '
- what are you doing ?
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: kettering town 'unlikely ' to return to rockingham roadnorthampton
text: the chief executive of kettering borough council says it 's ''unlikely '' the former rockingham road football ground will be made an `` asset of community value '' .
hundreds of fans presented a petition to the council last night in response to their decision .
the poppies currently play at latimer park in burton latimer after leaving rockingham road five years ago .
in april , the club made a request to list their former home as an asset of community value , which could have given the club the ability to bid should the land be sold .
the council 's chief executive david cook told fans he believes they can not legally list rockingham road as a community asset because the site has n't been used for community use in recent years .

but kettering town director ken samuel said : ''i would question the term recent recent years could be five years , 10 years or 20 years in the whole history of the club and it 's down to interpretation in my book . ''
established in 1872 , the club has been going for 144 years and was once managed by ron atkinson .
paul gascoigne was part of the managing consortium in 2005 .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'alright me duck ? '
text: it 's been claimed the northamptonshire accent could eventually disappear .
a report out today says people 's mobility is destroying the traditional way of speaking in many areas of the county .
doctor dominic watt , an expert in language and dialects at the university of york , says 'northamptonshire , the tradition rural dialect , is under threat of erosion '' .
higham ferrers-born david wilson is the author of 'that 'll lern yer ' , a dictionary of northamptonshire dialect .
he says ''the further west you go , the more birmingham you tend to become and the further to the east you go the more of the norfolk , suffolk , eastern , cambridgeshire kind ''
some unique northamptonshire words include a 'jitty ' which is an alleyway and 'frit ' which means being frightened or scared .

documents.title: thursday 's weather : rain at first , brighter later
text: it 'll be a cloudy start with outbreaks of rain , which may turn locally heavier for a time , but then clearing by early afternoon .
drier and fresher conditions will follow with some long spells of sunshine .
it will be a breezy day , especially in coastal areas , with a top temperature of 19c ( 68f ) .
remaining dry overnight with some clear spells .
lows of 11c ( 52f ) .
weather has the full forecast where you live .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

text: good morning and welcome back to our regular updates from the local live team in northamptonshire .
it 's lovely weather here for ducks !
we 'll bring you all today 's news , weather , sport and travel .
it 's a grey start to the day in the county , as you can see .
here 's a view of a very wet .
abington square in northampton this morning .

text: that 's it for our regular updates of news , traffic , sport and weather for the day - any breaking news will appear here overnight .
join us tomorrow for news of a march by campaigners who want to save kettering town 's old ground at rockingham road .
and we 'll be exploring whether northamptonshire 's traditional accent is dying out .
have a good evening .

documents.title: regional weather : a cloudy and breezy night ahead
text: turning a little cloudy this evening with the chance of some patchy rain later across western counties .
it 'll be breezy overnight , but remaining mild .
temperatures down to 15c ( 59f ) .
tomorrow will start cloudy with outbreaks of rain .
gradually improving and becoming brighter with sunny spells .
highs of 18c ( 64f ) .
find your local forecast at bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: extra funds for advice services
text: politicians are likely to approve thousands of pounds of extra cash for two advice services in northampton at a meeting tonight .
£ 300,000 will be split between the citizens advice bureau and the community law service for the next two years .

documents.title: murdered pensioner 's vigil flowers stolen
text: family flowers laid in memory of a murdered grandfather were stolen shortly before a vigil to mark one year since his death .
david brickwood , 74 , was stabbed five times on 26 september 2015 in a `` violent and dreadful '' attack at his northampton home .
he died in hospital .
no-one 's been charged with his murder and on monday night friends held a candlelit vigil outside his lindsay avenue home .
however , one family member noticed a bunch of red roses they 'd laid there earlier was missing .
mr brickwood 's son dale checked cctv images later and said a couple had come along , read the cards on some flowers and then walked off with the roses .
they were `` heartless parasites '' and `` low-lifes '' , he said , defiling his father 's memory .
mr brickwood said he would n't be informing police of the theft as investigators were busy trying to find his father 's killers .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: happy sights in east northants
text: politicians and residents have been leaping to the defence of east northamptonshire after a government survey suggested it was the least happy place in the uk .
the annual well-being report placed the district at the bottom of the happiness category .
people who live there have been telling us about the great community spirit here 's our tribute to some of them .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northants sign fast bowler nathan buck
text: northamptonshire have signed fast bowler nathan buck from lancashire .
the 25-year-old , who began his career at leicestershire before moving to old trafford , has joined northants on a three-year deal .
buck was a great prospect at grace road but has struggled since moving north - playing just 19 matches across two injury-hit seasons .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: northants sign buck from lancashire
text: northants sign buck from lancashire

documents.title: most people 'very happy ' with life in east northants , council says
text: politicians in east northamptonshire have been responding to news that a government survey suggests it 's the least happy place in the uk .
the annual well-being survey from the office of national statistics asked people to rate their lives against four key indicators .
east northamptonshire came bottom in the happiness category .

glenn harwood , deputy leader of east northants council , said : `` we 're pleased to report the results of our most recent survey show that the majority of people ( 85 % ) are very happy with east northamptonshire as a place to live . ''
mr harwood said there are `` great areas of natural beauty , such as the nene valley and stanwick lakes '' (
he added that life will improve further with the arrival of the rushden lakes development next year with a `` spectacular '' retail offer and cinema .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: body talk is coming your way # bbcbodytalk
text: in honour of women 's sport week ( 3-9 october ) , bbc get inspired and radio 1xtra have teamed up for an intimate and interactive discussion on body image issues for women in and around sport .
full details about how you can be there , get involved and watch it live can be found here .

documents.title: judge bans publication of pippa middleton photographs
text: a high court judge has ordered that 3,000 photographs allegedly stolen from pippa middleton 's private icloud account should not be published .
a man has been released on bail after being arrested in northamptonshire on saturday in connection with the police investigation into the incident .
ms middleton , the sister of the duchess of cambridge , has launched a civil action against `` a person or persons unknown '' followed the apparent attack on her account .
judge philippa whipple 's order will include any personal information involved in the alleged hack and prevent publication by anyone who is aware of the injunction .
ms middleton 's lawyer said she was not worried about publication by the mainstream media .
it was more likely that the would be released by `` rogue elements on the internet '' .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: motorcycle crash victim named
text: a motorcyclist who died in a crash near daventry has been named .
gary bates , who was 49 and from the town , was seriously injured on charwelton road last saturday .
he died in hospital .
the driver of a bmw was arrested at the scene .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton forget player 's shirt
text: northampton forget player 's shirt

documents.title: northampton town centre body cameras will 'defuse conflict '
text: politicians say body cameras , which could be introduced in northampton town centre , should act as a visible deterrent in difficult situations .
the campaign group big brother watch has said that staff using the equipment will have to be properly trained to make sure they do n't make secret recordings .
councillor alan bottwood said the cameras will be visible on the clothing of parking attendants and neighbourhood wardens .
`` if they get in a conflict situation they will be able to say 'look , i 'm going to turn my camera on ' .
the police say that , when they do that it can defuse a conflict situation '' .
i tend to think that i 'm a law-abiding citizen .
if i 'm doing not doing anything wrong , does it matter that they 've got me on camera ? ''
author: Stuart Linnell
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: body cameras in northampton 'must not be used for covert recording '
text: privacy campaigners say council staff must be trained properly before they 're allowed to use body cameras in northampton town centre .
the borough council is planning to introduce the equipment for parking attendants and neighbourhood wardens so they can record incidents as they happen .
the cameras are already widely used by the police .
daniel nesbitt , from the campaign group big brother watch , told me earlier that full training is crucial : `` there must be no potential for any covert recording as that should n't be happening .
`` members of the public would n't have the chance to modify their behaviour , so the point of the cameras would be invalid , '' he said .
author: Stuart Linnell
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: east northants 'least happy ' place in the uk ? absolutely not !
text: reaction has been coming in to our story about the government survey which suggested that east northamptonshire is the least happy place in the country .
corby came bottom in the life satisfaction category in the ons well-being study .
responding on social media , police inspector julie mead said `` absolutely not !
great towns and great communities.. what makes me happy re northants , it 's community spirit '' .
liz coombe , a wellingborough councillor , tweeted that `` all the cheeriest people i know live in corby .
what a rubbish survey '' .

twitter user `` safetyjord '' said that one happy thing about northamptonshire was the `` good transport links to nicer counties '' , and `` @ nmptonsneakerco '' praised the county 's food , scenery and footwear .
northamptonsneakerco
nmptonsneakerco
@ twitterid country pubs , real ale , gentle rolling hills , awesome driving/cycling roads , mild weather , incredible shoes .
east northamptonshire has been named the least happy place in great britain .
do you agree ?
what about northamptonshire makes you happy ?
country pubs , real ale , gentle rolling hills , awesome driving/cycling roads , mild weather , incredible shoes .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: happiness survey could generate improvements in east northants
text: a survey that says east northamptonshire is the least happy place in the uk could generate improvements , according to a statistician .
the office of national statistics asked thousands of people to rate their lives against four key indicators for their annual well-being survey .
east northamptonshire scored just 7.01 out of 10 for happiness , while corby achieved the bottom score for life satisfaction .
matt steel , from the ons , says the survey `` allows people the insight and the scope to make improvements to what makes our lives good .
we think it 's a real case for action '' .
here are the happiness scores for the whole county :
author: Willy Gilder
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: labour politicians 'amazed ' by kettering council tax decision
text: opposition councillors in kettering have criticised plans to cut council tax support for vulnerable people in the borough .
last year , the council introduced new rules requiring the poorest people to pay at least 45 % of their bills , but the council 's now consulting on a move to increase that figure to 68 % .

mick scrimshaw , who 's a labour councillor , said : `` last year , i genuinely believed that they did n't understand where this left kettering compared with the whole country.. we told them , they still went ahead , and they still doing it again this year . ''
no-one from the ruling conservative group has been available for comment so far .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: northamptonshire one of 'least happy ' parts of uk
text: yesterday we told you about a report from oxford economics which described northampton as an `` economic powerhouse '' worth approximately £ 6bn a year .
that may be , but it 's another day and another survey and we 've now been told that northamptonshire appears to be one of the least happy parts of the country .
the annual well-being survey by the office for national statistics says two areas of the county - east northamptonshire , and corby - come bottom of the lists for happiness and life satisfaction .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northampton council workers could wear body cams
text: northampton borough council says it is considering plans to allow its staff to record activity in the town centre using body cameras , in the hope they will improve standards of cleanliness and safety .
parking attendants , park rangers and neighbourhood wardens may be able to monitor behaviour if the new plans are approved .
full training would be given to members of staff using the devices , which are already used by northamptonshire police , but privacy groups including big brother uk say they should be banned .
we 'll find out if the scheme has been given the go ahead next month .
author: Samuel Boyle
BBC Radio Northamptonshire

documents.title: kettering council tax support could fall further
text: a northamptonshire council that offers the lowest level of council tax support in the country is considering cutting the benefit further .
in kettering everyone who receives the means-tested support .
has to pay at least 45 % of their bill .
now the borough council is consulting on changes and one option would see that figure rise to 68 % .
it says it should get more money from central government to fund the benefit .
in corby and south northamptonshire people have to pay a minimum of 8.5 % of their bill .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: today 's weather : dry with sunny spells
text: today is due to be dry with some cloud and sunny periods , but the cloud will tend to increase later in the afternoon .
winds will become stronger later , but it will feel warm in shelter .
maximum temperature : 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back to live updates for northamptonshire
text: good morning and welcome to another day of live updates of news , sport , weather , travel and more for northamptonshire .
today we 'll start by looking at what the weather has in store for us today with a full forecast .
you can get in touch with all your comments , photographs and news via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: swindon town 1-3 northampton town
text: swindon town 1-3 northampton town

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: that 's the end of our rolling updates for today , but any breaking news will still appear here overnight .
stories we 've covered today include :
do n't forget to join us again from 08:00 tomorrow when we 'll have all the latest news , sport , weather and traffic updates for northamptonshire .
have a great evening .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : a clear and mild night
text: cloud and patchy drizzle will clear , to leave a dry night with clear spells .
it will stay mild , with temperatures falling to 9c ( 48f ) in a south-westerly breeze .
wednesday should be mostly dry , with some lengthy sunny spells .
feeling warm , with temperatures reaching 23c ( 73f ) .
weather has more details for where you live .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: commissioner defends police overspend
text: the county 's police and crime commissioner has answered questions about the £ 3.1m overspend expected at northamptonshire police this year , which we mentioned earlier in the northamptonshire telegraph .

speaking to a meeting of county councillors , stephen mold said the overspend is expected to reduce before the end of the financial year and that training costs and extra spending on road policing are to blame .
he said : ''policing is facing a period of substantial financial pressure , although we have financial reserves to cover any overspend at this stage . ''
''it is our priority to work with northamptonshire police to deliver a new service delivery model to that ensure we are both more efficient in our work and therefore our spending . ''
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: northampton named as 'major growth ' area
text: a new report from oxford economics says northampton has a key role to play as part of a `` major growth corridor '' spanning the south midlands and the east of england .
it follows a directive from former chancellor , george osborne , to the national infrastructure commission to examine ways to maximise the area 's potential .
it spans from oxford to milton keynes then across to cambridge .
in the report , northampton is described as having `` the potential to play a significant role in ensuring that the growth corridor achieves its potential '' .
it also states the town `` is already a prominent regional economic centre '' , employing more than 140,000 people across a wide range of sectors .
the study predicts strong expansion in northampton over the next 15 years , with job growth outstripping the rest of the `` growth corridor '' area at almost twice that of the uk .
strengths include its location , opportunities for investors to make good returns and excellent quality of life for residents .
the report also describes northampton as an economic powerhouse worth approximately £ 6bn a year .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: kettering councillor resigns in council tax row
text: a kettering borough councillor has resigned from the ruling conservative group in a row over the level of council tax support offered by the authority .
michael brown , who represents brambleside ward , says he does n't want to see a proposed cut in the benefit and walked out of a private party meeting following an argument .
the group leader , russell roberts , told bbc radio northampton he 's `` sad '' about the resignation and claims mr brown had `` his own reasons '' for becoming an independent .

documents.title: green light for motocross racing despite objections
text: plans for a motocross track near the village of yelvertoft have been approved by daventry district councillors .
the proposal is for a seven-day-a-week , all-year round practice circuit to be built to the the west of the village and north of crick .
planning councillors had deferred a decision on the circuit back in august as they wanted to see the results of an independent noise assessment and visit the site themselves .
people in yelvertoft had objected to the plans saying the tranquillity of village life would be ruined .
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: duckett wins young cricketer of the year award
text: meanwhile , northants batsman ben duckett has been named today as young cricketer of the year , by members of the cricket writers ' club .
the 21-year old scored more than 2,000 runs for the county in all competitions this summer .
he 's the first northants player to win the award since rob bailey in 1984 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: vote for northants ' best sporting star
text: got sport withdrawal symptoms now the olym and paralym seem like a distant memory ?
then why not vote for your favourite northamptonshire sports personality from the last 12 months

northants sport is asking everyone to vote for their favourite from a list of 12 nominees , including burton latimer golfer charley hull ( cobblers ' john-joe o'toole and great britain wheelchair tennis star dermot bailey .
the winner will be announced at a ceremony on 10 november .
do n't forget to vote for your northamptonshire sport 's personality of the year .
you 've got until 14th october 5pm
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northampton town v swindon preview
text: northampton town hope to build on saturday 's win this evening when they travel to swindon in league one .
the cobblers are currently fifth in the table .
rob page 's side swept southend aside at the weekend but expects a different style of opposition this evening .
''swindon get the ball and play good but it 'll be a different game in that respect , it wo n't be as direct , '' he said .
`` they 've had an ok start to season .
we 'll have to be disciplined about our performances and it 's an away performance , but we are still going there to win the game . ''
you can hear full match commentary of tonight 's match on bbc radio northampton - 104.2 and 103.6 fm - from 19:00 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather update
text: it 's still looking a bit grey and dark in the county this lunchtime , but there 's some brighter weather on the way this afternoon , along with a bit of a breeze .
highs of 19c ( 66f ) .
here is weather watcher will 's photo of fawsley earlier .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: 'the rewards this brings are incredible ' # bbcunsunghero
text: there are 15 people who will be named a bbc get inspired unsung hero around the uk once again this year and one of those from last year - carl eaton - has revealed the impact the award has had on him and the work he does
`` if you know anybody who is worthy of this award , nominate them , '' carl adds .
`` it will be the best thing you ever did . ''
nominate an unsung hero from your area here - and hurry as nominations close on sunday , 23 october .

documents.title: plans for another night shelter for town
text: a decision will be made today on plans to turn an old northampton social club into a night shelter for homeless people .
if northampton borough councillors approve the plan , the british rail sports and social club on st andrews road would house up to 20 people .
the change of use , which would be in force for two years , is recommended for approval .

documents.title: 'road to nowhere ' finally going somewhere ?
text: it 's been known as the `` road to nowhere '' for ages - but now it could finally have a purpose .
i 'm on about the new road just to the west of northampton that runs north from the a4500 , near harpole , for all of about 200m and then just stops .
but now plans are being put forward that could see it connect up with the sandy lane relief road , which runs from harlestone to duston .
this is because of plans for 1,900 houses to be built between upton and harpole , that would include the road being completed .
sonja roberts from the harpole action team , says people in the village are n't happy , saying the homes would effectively join the village to northampton .
the plans will be determined by south northants council , but northampton 's planning committee will be discussing it tonight .

documents.title: in the papers today
text: the northants evening telegraph reports northamptonshire police is set to overspend on this year 's budget by £ 3.1m .

the paper says the police and crime commissioner stephen mold will today explain to members of the county police and crime panel why the force 's forecast budget for the 2016/17 fiscal year is so high .

meanwhile , the northampton chronicle and echo says a retired teacher has launched a campaign to make a dangerous road safer after freedom of information figures revealed seven people had died in accidents in the past decade .
the chron says pas render is trying to get the 50mph limit on boughton lane in northampton lowered to 30mph .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: will our local boy be hired or fired ?
text: `` if i wanted to be like everyone else , i 'd have waxed my monobrow . ''
those are the words of local it entrepreneur karthik nagesan , who will be hoping to impress lord sugar in the next series of bbc 's the apprentice .
the full line-up of contestants for the bbc one show , which begins on 6 october , has just been announced , and includes 33-year-old karthik from kettering .
he owns an it consulting company and says his friends would describe him as a born leader who takes charge and blazes a trail .
he cites his role-model as alexander the great , because he is a master strategist and a brilliant tactician .
he believes he is firm , yet polite , making him the ultimate `` human magnet '' .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: reuniting stray dogs 'a nightmare ' , says animal charity
text: more than 80,000 stray dogs were handed over by local councils in northamptonshire in the 12 months until march , with only 54 % being successfully returned to their owners .
nationally 12 dogs a day are being put down because their microchip details are not up-to-date , according to the dogs trust .
northamptonshire charity animals in need , based in little irchester , helps re-home stray pets .
trustee roy marriott wants to bring back dog licences so owners can be traced easily .
he said : `` when you move you should update your microchip details as it 's a nightmare trying to find them [ the owners ] .
there are too many dogs , sanctuaries are chock-a-block with dogs . ''
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: silverstone buyer 'on verge of walking away '
text: an offer to buy silverstone circuit could be withdrawn if its current owners fail to respond , the bbc understands .

lawrence tomlinson has made an offer to buy the motorsport venue from the british racing drivers ' club ( brdc ) , but he 's reported to be about to pull out of the deal if he does n't get a response soon .
motorsport journalist christian sylt said the brdc embarked on discussions with mr tomlinson in july .
he said : ''he told me as recently as last week he 's getting frustrated by the lack of progress and if there is n't progress soon then he 's going to have to take his offer off the table . ''
derek warwick , president of the brdc , told bbc radio northampton : ''lawrence has made an offer as have a few other people as well , we 're looking at all of them now .
`` some of them have come in quite late .
am i convinced we can do a deal ?
no , i am not really , because it 's got to be the right deal for the members . ''

documents.title: 'uk 's first ' tahini factory to open in corby
text: a food manufacturer based in the arabian gulf and the middle east is opening a factory in corby with the creation of up to 300 jobs over the next three years .
al seedawi makes tahini , which is sesame paste .
the company says all of the tahini used in the uk is currently imported .

managing director tarek al seedawi says : `` there is n't any other tahini factory in the uk , on the other hand there is a a huge demand for tahini probably when you buy your shopping for a restaurant , the most expensive item on the list is tahini . ''
production is due to start in january with an initial 50 to 70 jobs being created .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : cloudy start but turning brighter
text: today will be cloudy with some light rain in places and there will be a slight breeze .
cloud will begin to clear later .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f ) .
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to our live coverage
text: good morning and welcome to northamptonshire live on tuesday , 27 september .
stay with us as we bring you regular live updates of the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the county until 18:00 .
you can get in touch with all your comments , photographs and news via email , facebook or twitter .
do n't forget to send your to bbc weather watchers .
here is weather watcher netty 's photo of braunston this morning .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: that 's the end of our rolling updates for today , but any breaking news will still appear here overnight .
stories we 've covered today include :
do n't forget to join us tomorrow from 08:00 when we 'll have all the latest news , sport , weather and traffic updates for northamptonshire .
have a great evening .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: harborough getting full-time fire crew
text: the fire station in market harborough will be staffed full-time as of wednesday .
there 'll be a crew there between 07:00-18:00 seven days a week .
up until now there 's just been an on-call crew .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : rain clearing to leave a largely dry night
text: rain will clear north-eastwards this evening .
the rest of the night will be largely dry and cloudy with a few clear intervals .
we may get some further outbreaks of rain developing in the west of the eastern region later .
minimum temperature 11c ( 52f ) .
tomorrow , after some early brightness it 'll generally be cloudy and with some outbreaks of rain at times as temperatures peak at 20c ( 68f ) .
get your local forecast from bbc weather .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: warning over contaminated meat after sheep killed
text: police are warning people and businesses in the county to be vigilant of sus sales of meat after sheep given drugs to treat worms were stolen .
five sheep were stolen on two separate occasions from land near cottingham , close to corby .
five carcasses have been found and police say it was clear they were killed for their meat .
the day before the animals were given noromectin , which will cause sickness and diarrhoea .

documents.title: 'operator ? there 's a bug in my curry ! '
text: northamptonshire police has asked people to use 999 for the right reasons after getting a call about a bug in someone 's curry .
the force revealed the details as part of its .
# whoyougoingtocall day on twitter , looking at the calls it receives in its control room .
here 's some more `` emergencies '' it 's had to deal with today
the force tweeted : `` 999 is for emergencies .
think before you dial it .
is there a life in danger , crime in progress ?
if not then ring us on 101 . ''
999 is for emergencies .
think before you dial it .
is there a life in danger , crime in progress ?
if not then ring us on 101 # whoyougoingtocall
actual 999 calls we have received there 's a bug in my curry '' my cat has gone out after a hedgehog and i am worried it will get hurt ''
did the cat get hurt ?
i can confirm that no cats or hedgehogs were hurt during this incident .
@ twitterid let 's hope person with curry falls into a corma n let 's hope hedgehog complainant falls n lands on it bum first
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rob page : 'important ' for cobblers to get back to winning ways
text: following northampton town 's 4-0 thumping of southend on saturday , manager rob page said it was `` important '' the club responded to the defeat the week before .
after a goalless first half , northampton scored three goals in 14 minutes at the start of the second to leave the visitors stunned .

page said he was disappointed with the last cobblers performance at chesterfield , which ended a tremendous run of form for the side , adding ''it was important to put that right and scoring four and keeping a clean sheet and i think we 've put that right . ''
next up is a trip to swindon tomorrow night .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: today in northamptonshire
text: today in northamptonshire

documents.title: corby man found guilty of murder
text: a jury at northampton crown court has found a corby man guilty of murder after he assaulted a man at a fast food outlet in the town last year .

ashley palmer , 33 , was originally charged with grievous bodily harm after 38-year old bernard farrell of birmingham suffered serious head injuries in the assault at kfc on oakley road on 3 november .
he was taken to university hospital coventry where he died 13 november .
this morning the jury found palmer , of moss walk , corby , guilty .
no date was set for sentencing as judge rupert mayo wanted to give probation officers time to draw up reports on the defendant .
he said : `` there is only one sentence i can pass and it will have to be a life sentence '' .

documents.title: this afternoon 's weather
text: it 's been raining in many parts of the county this lunchtime and there 's more to come
the rest of the day will be mainly cloudy with some showers or longer spells of rain .
the worst of the rain is likely to be in the west of the county , but some eastern areas could stay dry .
temperatures will reach a high of 15c ( 59f ) .
here 's the scene in raunds this lunchtime sent in to bbc weather watchers by willow .
if you 'd like to become a weather watcher , find out more here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: police investigate attempted abduction
text: police are investigating an attempted abduction in northampton .
officers say a woman was walking down birchfield road east in abington on friday afternoon while listening to music in her headphones .
a man in a red volkswagen polo then pulled over to ask for directions and grabbed the victim 's right arm .
she managed to pull away and run off .
the suspect was white , aged in his mid-40s with an english accent .
he also had messy brown hair .
anyone with information is asked to contact northamptonshire police .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ashley residents save 'george '
text: we 've heard numerous stories of pubs closing down , but here 's a tale of how residents secured the future of the last remaining pub in their village .
when an application was submitted last year to turn the george pub in ashley , near corby , into houses , the locals were horrified .
after objecting to the plans , the proposal was turned down by kettering borough councillors .
six months on and the pub has reopened with a makeover and under new ownership .
ashley resident sosennah every said : ''it 's absolutely brilliant it 's something that everyone has really fought for , it 's very exciting '' .
author: Carroll Weston
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'colossal ' wasp nest found in attic
text: 'colossal ' wasp nest found in attic

documents.title: northampton saints 15-20 wasps
text: northampton saints 15-20 wasps

documents.title: adrenaline rush for the next olym
text: managers at corby 's indoor centre for skateboarding , adrenaline alley , are hoping to win funding to turn it into a uk training centre for olympic athletes .
skateboarding will be an olympic sport at the next games in tokyo , and adrenaline alley claims to be europe 's biggest indoor urban skate park .

mandy young from the centre , which has just celebrated its 10th anniversary , said : `` we have everything here for the training , we have got land here we can still develop on , so if we needed to put a purpose-built facility in for future olym it 's possible to do that '' .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: motorcyclist dies in crash
text: a motorcyclist has died following a collision near daventry .
the 49-year old man was riding his bike along charwelton road towards preston capes when it struck a car .
he was airlifted to hospital in coventry , where he died yesterday afternoon .
the driver of the car , a 32-year-old man , was arrested at the scene .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: strictly come dancing : local lass lesley waltzes to theme tune
text: the class of 2016 finally took to the floor in strictly come dancing over the weekend .
we saw northampton actress lesley joseph dance a waltz with partner anton du beke to the theme tune of her comedy series , birds of a feather .
judge darcey bussell said she was `` sophisticated and romantic '' .
craig revel horwood said his biggest concern was her posture , but added she had `` delicious flow '' .
if you missed local lass lesley , watch her waltz now to 'what 'll i do ? '
you can keep across all the dancing on the bbc strictly website as the series continues .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man bailed after pippa hacking arrest
text: in case you missed it yesterday , a 35-year-old man arrested in northamptonshire by police investigating claims that pippa middleton 's icloud account was hacked has been released on bail .
he was arrested on saturday evening on sus of an offence under the `` computer misuse act '' .
pictures of the duchess of cambridge and her children are reportedly among 3,000 images taken , according to scotland yard who say inquiries are continuing .

documents.title: thirty labour members in east join lib dems after corbyn re-election
text: since saturday , 30 labour members have quit the party and joined the liberal democrats in the east of england , according to the lib dem 's regional chairman .
stephen robinson told me a number of people switched after jeremy corbyn was re-elected following his convincing win over rival owen smith .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex political reporter

documents.title: giant wasps ' nest found in loft
text: my .
worst .
nightmare .
just look at the size of it
it 's even got an entry tunnel ( shudder )
this colossal wasps ' nest , home for up to 10,000 of the stinging insects , has been found in an attic near corby , northamptonshire .
first reported on the evening telegraph website , a homeowner found the one-metre wide nest ( 3.2ft ) in the loft while renovating his house , which had been empty for years .
peterborough pest controller gary wilkinson said `` luckily '' the wasps moved out about a year earlier .
however , he said its size and long entry tunnel made for a `` spectacular work of art '' .
phobia aside , he 's right you know
meanwhile , in the past week there 's been a 1,000 % rise in the number of people searching google to find out when wasps will die in the uk , after a reported rise in the insects this summer .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: paralympic swimming champion returns to school
text: northampton 's paralympic gold medallist ellie robinson ( centre on lap ) has retuned to school today for the first time since her triumph in rio .
there 's just been a special assembly in her honour at northampton high school , which we captured on facebook live .
the 15-year-old took up swimming just four years ago .
helen stringer , the school 's headteacher , said everyone is very proud of ellie , adding she `` was so composed under such pressure she did it beautifully '' in rio .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live

documents.title: north praised for 'tremendous ' display
text: north praised for 'tremendous ' display

documents.title: david brickwood murder case : police say someone knows who killed northampton man
text: northamptonshire police is appealing for people to come forward to solve the killing of david brickwood , with the force convinced someone has information to offer .
the northampton man was stabbed a year ago after a break-in at his home in lindsay avenue , in the abington area of the town .
det ch insp louise hemingway says she is certain `` the resolution of this lies within the community '' .
i think people do know what has happened who did this to him ?
i need them to come and talk to us . ''

documents.title: david brickwood murder case : why wo n't 'spineless ' people talk about pensioner 's killing ?
text: one year ago today , 74-year-old david brickwood woke up , confronted by his killers .
they had broken in to his home in lindsay avenue , in northampton 's abington area in the early hours of saturday , 26 september 2015 .
the pensioner was stabbed five times as he attempted to defend himself against his attackers , who got away with cash and jewellery .
he died later from a heart attack , brought on by a loss of blood , his eldest son told me .
`` it 's been a year and we still do n't have answers , '' gary brickwood said .
`` northampton knows who did this .
they 're gutless and spineless and afraid to talk to the police . ''
six people arrested in connection with david brickwood 's death have been released without further action .
no-one 's been charged , but police say investigations are continuing .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: weather : a week of unsettled weather
text: it 's a cloudy start to an unsettled week of weather .
some of you may have woken up to a dry start , but outbreaks of rain will push in from the west later .
temperatures reaching a high of 17 ( c ) ( 62f ) .
watch my full forecast :
weather has more details for where you live .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning and welcome to northamptonshire live for monday , 26 september .
stay with us as we bring you regular live updates of the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the county until 18:00 .
you can get in touch with all your comments , photographs and news by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Helen Popham
BBC Local Live
